bibl.title: Despatch from Owen L. W. Smith to David J. Hill, December 17, 1901
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

p.add: INDEX BUREAU REC'D FEB 5 1902 DEPT OF STATE
ConBureau Aus report has now been read Feby 7-1902

div1.p: No. 88. Consular. Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia Liberia, December 17, 1901.
Hon. David J. Hill, Assistant Secretary of State Washington.
Subject. Description of office &c, as per Departments Circular instruction of April 19, 1901, was forwarded, in duplicate July 10, 1901.
No. 88, Consular. Consulate General of the United States Monrovia Liberia, December 17, 1901.
Hon. David J. Hill, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington.

Sir: I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt December 14, 1901, of your dispatch of November 15, 1901, through the Third Assistant Secretary of State calling my attention to the Departments circular instructions of APril 19, 1901, calling for a report descriptions of office &c.
In reply, I have to say that said report was dispatched, in duplicate, per S. S. Adolph
Adolph Walrmann, via Plyouth, by registered package No. 1,099, postage prepaid $1.45, July 10, 1901.
However, I have ordered that duplicate copies be made and forwarded at the earliest possible moment.
I have further to say that you may, at any an all times, be assured of the fact, that such flagrant neglect of a known duty, is not characteristic of the undersigned.
I have the honor to be your obedient servant; Owen L. W. Smith Consul General
